Comment: I like this challenge
Super

Interesting challenge, but the challenge description could use a lot of work.

The example patterns do not make it clear that the name should be present for any rarity.
The Epic example pattern is not the same as the expected pattern in the tests.
The description should show or tell that the name and rarity should be centered, and the attributes should be ajusted to the left.
The description seems to say that only Legendary items should show the item name, which is not the case in the test cases.
More example tests would be welcome. At least one for each rarity level.
There should be at least 2 Legendary examples : One where the box length is odd, and another where it is even, since the test cases expect different behaviour for each case.
There should be examples where the name length and the box length do not have the same oddity, since there are 2 ways to center the text in that case. Same for rarity.
It would be nice for the constraints to indicate the minimum and maximum length expected for attribute names and values, and the maximum number of attributes expected. It is useful for language that do not have auto allocated strings, such as C.

Very interesting challenge. 

Two quick remarks though:
- It's not clear in the intructions that the ItemName and Rarity have to be centered inside the frame.  (but from the expected outputs it seems that's needed)
- You should add the ItemName part in all exemple template (the note isn't clear and points to ItemName only be required on Legendary items (TenDRILLL also pointed that out).

Challenge itself is nice, the description could use work as from the first read of it,
I would understand that the itemName only goes to the Legendary itemRarity items.
The Example below however indicates otherwise.
super
Im just commenting, because I approve ur profile picture

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Reasoning:

Clear Objective:

Goal: Generate ASCII art frames based on item rarity, which is well-defined and relevant for game development.

Input/Output: Clearly specified format with multiple examples covering all rarity types.

Appropriate Constraints:

Item Name Length (5-100 characters): Prevents excessively long or short inputs.
Defined Rarities: Limits to "Common," "Rare," "Epic," or "Legendary," simplifying frame selection.

Difficulty Level:

Easy: Suitable for beginners, focusing on string manipulation and conditional logic.
Comprehensive Test Cases:

Examples cover all rarity levels and various attribute combinations, ensuring robust solution handling.

Educational Value:

Enhances skills in parsing strings, formatting output, and applying conditional structures.

Recommendations:
Edge Cases: Add tests for minimum and maximum item name lengths.
Attribute Order: Specify if attribute order must follow input sequence.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Goal
* Please change "later" to "later. The frame to output depends on [[itemRarity]]. I let you guess what it is :D".

Input
* Please add "in the format of [[itemName]]{{,}}[[itemRarity]]{{,}}[[attribute1]]{{:}}[[value1]]{{,}}[[attribute2]]{{:}}[[value2]]‚Ä¶".

Constraints
* Please delete the first three constraints.

* Please format "itemName" and "itemRarity" as [[variables]] instead of {{constants}}.

Cover picture
* Suggest to upload a cover picture for the puzzle.

Thanks.

You can format the frames in Goal section in monospace like this (surround the block of text with 3 backticks at the beginning and at the end):

```
##########
# Common #
##########
```

Thanks.
The frames in Goal section are broken‚Ä¶?

i changed the frames again, they were looking strange for me?
gonna change that again, let's say i'm the problem :D
done, is it better?

There's still an issue with the first two (see screenshot below):

https://imgur.com/a/N4fxexm

Also, would you please amend the notes as follows:

* Point 1: Format "ItemName" and "ItemRarity" as [[variables]].

* Point 2: We cannot see 2 spaces to the right of "CenteredText". You need to format that as monospace like this:
`" CenteredText  "` (with a backtick before and after).

* Point 3: Format "ItemName" and "ItemRarity" as [[variables]].

* Point 3 & Point 4: Format "Legendary" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Point 4: Please add "(1 {{_}} in the middle)" after odd, and "(2 {{_}} in the middle)" after even.

Thanks.
everything is done. thank you so much for your precious help!

For centered text, the space actually goes to the left instead of to the right‚Ä¶? (See "Increased rarity" (Test) for example.)

The bottom edge of the Epic frame in Goal section is also wrong (should be _ instead of -).

I'm very disappointed that none of the approvers point out any issues.
I've corrected the statement just now. Please be more careful if you create contributions in the future. Thanks.
Thank you. Your feedbacks were very helpful for publishing my contribution and make it clean. I'll try my best to be more careful in the future.
I've further added the rule on attributes in Goal section, as requested on the forum: https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-item-maker-puzzle-discussion/205554/4
